Incident Investigation
Prestage Foods promptly investigates incidents that has resulted or could have reasonably resulted in a catastrophic release of a regulated substance. These investigations are undertaken to identify the situation leading to the incident as well as any corrective actions to prevent the release from reoccurring. All reports are retained for a minimum of 5 years.

Employee Participation
Prestage Foods believes that process safety management and accident prevention is a team effort. Company employees are encouraged to express their views concerning accident prevention issues and to recommend improvements. In addition, our employees have access to all information collected as part of the facility's compliance with the RMP Rule including information resulting from process hazard analyses.

Contractors
On occasion, our company hires contractors to conduct specialized maintenance and construction activities. Prior to selecting a contractor, a thorough evaluation of safety performance of the contractor is carried out. Prestage Foods has a policy of informing the contractors of known potential hazards related the contractor's work and the processes. Contractors are also informed of all applicable procedures for emergency response to an accidental release of a regulated substance.

Five-year Accident History
Prestage Foods works continuously to prevent any accident from occurring. Currently, there have been no reportable ammonia releases as this is a new facility.

Emergency Response Plan
Prestage Foods has implemented an emergency action plan in the event of an accidental release of ammonia. The emergency action plan includes facility evacuations and notification of local emergency response agencies.

Planned Changes to Improve Safety

a regular interval of 5 years.  Any findings related to the hazard analysis are addressed in a timely manner.

Operating Procedures
For the purposes of safely conducting activities within our covered process, Prestage Foods maintains written operating procedures.  These procedures address various modes of operation such as initial startup, normal operations, temporary operations, emergency shutdown, emergency operations, normal shutdown and startup after a turnaround. The information is reviewed and is readily accessible to operators involved with the process.

Training
Prestage Foods has a training program in place to train employees who are operating the process or are associated with the process. Refresher training will be provided at least every three (3) years and more frequently as needed.

Mechanical Integrity
Prestage Foods conducts documented preventive maintenance on process equipment to ensure proper operation per the manufactures recommendations and industry good practice. Inspection and testing of equipment follow the IIAR guidance.  Any equipment deficiencies identified during maintenance inspections and PMs are corrected in a safe and timely manner.

Management of Change
Written procedures are in place at Prestage Foods to manage changes in process chemicals, technology, equipment, and procedures. Process operators, maintenance personnel and all other employees whose job tasks are affected by a change in a process are promptly made aware of and offered training to deal with the changes.

Pre-startup Reviews
Pre-start up safety reviews related to new processes and to modifications in the established process are conducted as a regular practice at Prestage Foods. These reviews are conducted to confirm that construction, equipment, operating and maintenance procedures are suitable for safe startup prior to placing equipment into operation.

Executive Summary

Stationary Source and the Regulated Substances Handled
Prestage Foods is a poultry processing facility. Anhydrous ammonia is the only regulated substance present at the Camden, South Carolina facility per EPA Regulation 40 CFR Part 68. The entire ammonia inventory is attributed to its use as a refrigerant.

Accidental Release Prevention and Emergency Response Policies
Prestage Foods is committed to employee, public and environmental safety. Our comprehensive accidental release prevention program that covers areas such as design, installation, operating procedures, and maintenance demonstrates this
commitment, and employee training associated with the processes at our facility. It is our policy to implement appropriate controls to prevent possible releases of regulated substances.

Worst Case Release Scenario and the Alternative Release Scenario
Worst case and alternate release scenarios were developed using the EPAs RMPComp internet-based program. The details of the chosen scenarios are located within the Risk Management Program that is located on site.

Accidental Release Prevention and the Chemical-Specific Prevention Program
Prestage Foods has taken all the necessary steps to comply with the accidental release prevention requirements set out under 40 CFR Part 68 of the EPA. In addition, our facility is subject to the OSHA PSM standard under 29 CFR 1910.119. The following sections briefly describe the elements of the release prevention program that is in place at our stationary source.

Process Safety Information
Prestage Foods currently maintains a record of written process safety information that describes the chemical hazards, operating parameters and equipment designs associated with all the processes.

Process Hazard Analysis
